intro: Landolphia jumellei, commonly known as the giant African waterleaf, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
